alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Macon (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 2:43PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Bullock and southern Macon Counties through 330 PM CST... At 243 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Shopton, or 13 miles west of Union Springs, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Union Springs, Midway, Hardaway, Shopton, Franklin Field, Warriorstand, Sedgefield, Three Notch, Mitchell, Simsville and Fort Davis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CST for south central and southeastern Alabama.
